com.unitedcaterers.serverwithoutlockcookie

Class RMIUCServerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • com.unitedcaterers.serverwithoutlockcookie.RMIUCServerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UCServerFactory, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class RMIUCServerImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements UCServerFactory
    Notice that in this package (com.unitedcaterers.serverwithoutcookie) RMIUCServer implements UCServerFactory, while in com.unitedcaterers.server package RMIUCServer implements UCServer. UCServerFactory has only one method - getClientProxy(), which returns a remote object that implements the desired business funtionality (UCServer or DataBase), while UCServer implements all the business functionality itself.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getClientProxy

        public ClientProxy getClientProxy()
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                  UCException
        Description copied from interface: UCServerFactory
        Note that the return type here is UCServer and not ClientProxy (even though as you may have observed, RMIUCServerFactoryImpl actually creates ClientProxy object. The reason is that ClientProxy is a server side implementation detail, which the client doesn't care about. Client only cares about UCServer (or Database if you are exposing the lower level functionality on client side).
        Specified by:
        getClientProxy in interface UCServerFactory
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        UCException
